Linus and Luke discuss the European Union’s sweeping new regulations for smartphones and tablets, covering durability, battery lifespan, repairability, and long-term software support. These rules force manufacturers to support devices well beyond the usual lifecycle, something the tech industry has long resisted.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GzkxbrENoCg

title: The EU Continues To Be Amazing

Linus and Luke discuss their early impressions of the Nintendo Switch 2. Despite solid hardware upgrades, interest at retail has been lower than expected, and concerns around pricing, repairability, and Nintendo’s restrictive policies are already surfacing. They explore whether the console feels like a true next-gen leap, or just a safer, more expensive iteration.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GzkxbrENoCg

title: Is the Switch 2 Already in Trouble?

Linus and Luke discuss AMD’s new RX 9060 XT and the frustrating trend of companies selling underpowered GPUs with barely any savings. They compare today’s pricing to 2008, bring up the "Boots Theory" to explain how it hurts lower-budget buyers, and highlight just how bad the value gap has gotten for gamers trying to stretch their dollars.
